2THICCC Login Settings Fitness Nutrition Profile <<<<<<< HEAD ======= This is the login page This is the settings page 2Thicc Fitness This is the nutrition page This is the main page This is the profile page Exercise List Please select your current fitness level: Welcome to 2Thicc Fitness!
We help you plan and execute your goals by choosing your preferred exercies and curating your own circuits! Below is out wide range of exercises available in our database: You can add, delete and keep track of your circuits with our Thiccbook: You are a new to working out and have little knowledge of exercies and little to no foundation, you are active 1–3 days a week An experienced trainee with a moderate to somewhat knowledge of exercises, you are active 3–5 days a week An advanced trainee, you have years of consistent experience working your body and you are active 4–7 days a week An exercise done laying with face, palms and toes facing down, keeping legs and back straight, extending arms straight to push body up and back down again
Target: Upper body, Shoulders The squat thrust builds strength and explosiveness in the lower body with an emphasis on the quads, glutes, and hamstrings.
Target: Lower body, legs The squat is a full-body fitness staple that works your glutes, quads, and hamstrings and sneakily strengthens your core
Target: Core, Legs The leg raise is a strength training exercise which targets the anterior hip flexors
Target: Legs The basic crunch is the consummate abdominal exercise in a strength-training program. Pay special attention to your form when you do crunches, especially if you have lower-back or neck problems
Target: Core, Abs A mountain climber is a bodyweight exercise that is useful for burning calories, building stamina and strengthening the core/nTarget: Core The plank (also called a front hold, hover, or abdominal bridge) is an isometric core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for the maximum possible time
Target: Core High Knees are a cardio-intensive exercise performed at a fast pace. It engages your core, strengthens all the muscles in your legs, gets your heart rate up and improves momentum, coordination and flexibility

Instructions:

1. Create an account before logging in.

2. Enter correct credentials to log in.
Stopwatch Weight (lbs) Height (in) BMI Hello blank fragment Main Screen Editor Profile Page Personal Information Stop Watch Body metrics Nutrition Water Consumption Caloric Intake Calendar Fitness Workout Information Item 2 Item 3 Profile Info Put info about your part here Fitness Info Put info about your part here Nutrition Info Put info about your part here Main Page Info 

Uses a recycler view to cycle through available activities.

Click the views to go to the activity of your choice.

Click the icon in the bottom right corner of the view to see information about the activity and author.

Add and remove items from the Recycler using the buttons in the view at the bottom of the Recycler View.



Version: 2.1
